description: Good morning, it's Georgie here in Sydney. Here’s what we’re looking at today...Today’s must-reads:• EU, Australia sign critical minerals deal• Australian retail sales stagnate • Australia’s pension assets near A$4 trillion milestone
title: Critical Minerals Pact

description: Venezuela withdrew an invitation to European Union election monitors, reducing the chances that the international community will accept the results of the upcoming presidential election in July.
title: Venezuela Bars EU Monitors From July Presidential Election

description: For most of his 30 years running a Chinese-owned company in the US, Ni Pin felt welcomed.
title: Chinese Firms Once Embraced, Now Shunned in US on Security Fears

description: The veteran MP Diane Abbott has had the Labour Party whip restored after it was suspended over a racism controversy, though it is unclear whether she will be allowed to stand for the party at the upcoming general election.
title: Diane Abbott Has Labour Party Whip Restored After Probe

description: The Democratic National Committee plans to nominate President Joe Biden in a virtual roll call ahead of their convention to ensure that he is on the ballot in Ohio.
title: Democrats Will Nominate Biden Virtually So He Can Get on Ohio’s Ballot

description: The White House said an Israeli strike on an encampment in Rafah that left dozens dead was devastating but would not cause President Joe Biden to freeze additional arms shipments to the country.
title: White House Says Israel’s Rafah Strike Doesn’t Cross Red Line

description: A disturbing number of Russian weapons are powered by electronic components from companies in the US and allied nations, a Biden administration official said Tuesday, as he appealed for firms to stem the flow of parts being used to wage war in Ukraine.
title: Too Many US Goods Still Getting to Russia, US Official Says

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Justin Sink previews an  upcoming big moment for the 2024 presidential race. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Case Verdict a Big Moment for the Presidential Race

description: The temporary pier the US military built to help deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza is being removed for repairs after damage from rough seas and turbulent weather, according to the Pentagon.
title: US Pier for Gaza Aid Being Removed for Repairs After Rough Seas

description: The UK’s main opposition Labour Party said it would almost halve the current backlog of people waiting for treatment in the National Health Service during its first term in office, a latest promise to try to win over voters that also draws attention to a missed pledge made by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak.
title: Labour Pledges to Halve National Health Service Backlog in Five Years in UK Vote Bid

description: The Biden administration is urging big technology companies to ramp up efforts to curb antisemitic content on social media and gaming platforms, which has surged in recent years.
title: US Presses TikTok, Meta, X to Crack Down on Antisemitic Posts

description: Germany and France have agreed to make rapid progress to deepen the European Union’s capital markets to boost investment in the bloc after years of discussions, French President Emmanuel Macron said.
title: Macron, Scholz Pledge to Turn Capital Markets Talk Into Reality

description: New Zealand’s new government is likely to announce bigger deficits and increased borrowing in its first budget as it presses ahead with tax cuts despite weaker revenue.
title: New Zealand Seen Posting Bigger Budget Deficits, Borrowing More

description: Donald Trump’s lawyer in his hush money criminal trial argued to a New York jury that the former president is a victim of extortion, saying the case is rooted in an effort to squeeze him for money before the 2016 election.
title: Trump Was Victim of Extortion, Lawyer Tells Hush-Money Jurors

description: Botswana granted a license to SpaceX’s Starlink unit, the latest African nation to allow the internet-services company to operate after it threatened to restrict services where it’s unlicensed.
title: Botswana Government Grants Musk’s Starlink an Operating License

description: One of Colombia’s biggest health insurers will gradually cease operations in the country’s public system to avoid further deterioration in its finances.
title: Top Insurer to Leave Colombia’s Public System Amid Petro Squeeze

description: Harvard University will no longer issue official statements about public matters that don’t “directly affect the university’s core function,” following months of turmoil over its response to the Hamas attack on Israel and ensuing retaliatory war in Gaza.
title: Harvard Plans to Stay Silent on Controversial Issues After Furor

description: Ukraine must be allowed to respond to Russian missile strikes by taking out the sites they are fired from, French President Emmanuel Macron said.
title: Macron Says Ukraine Must Be Allowed to Hit Russian Missile Sites

description: Keir Starmer’s poll-leading opposition Labour Party is seeking to reassure the City of London it is not considering further taxes on Britain’s banks if it wins power at the UK general election on July 4.
title: Labour Not Looking at New Tax Raid on Banks to Balance Budget

description: The first opinion polls since Prime Minister Rishi Sunak called the UK general election last week show no clear change to the electoral picture after the opening days of campaigning.
title: First Polls Since Sunak Called UK Election Show No Clear Change

description: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal has called on allies to deliver regular shipments of artillery ammunition from the Czech-led initiative starting next month as Kyiv seeks to repel Russia’s onslaught along the front line.
title: Ukraine Calls for Czech-Led Ammo Shipments to Start in June

description: A Queens state senator whose support is critical to Mets owner Steve Cohen’s plan to build an $8 billion casino and entertainment complex next to Citi Field said she won’t introduce legislation needed to move the project forward.
title: Cohen’s $8 Billion Casino Plan Dealt Blow by Queens Lawmaker

description: The federal judge overseeing Donald Trump’s classified documents case denied a request by Special Counsel Jack Smith to impose a gag order on the former president to protect law enforcement officers.
title: Trump Gag Order Bid Over False FBI Theory Denied in Florida Case

description: UK police will not take any more action in the investigation into Labour Party’s deputy leader Angela Rayner, following allegations she broke electoral law before becoming an MP.
title: UK Police Drop Investigation into Labour’s Deputy Leader

description: Georgian lawmakers overrode a presidential veto of a controversial “foreign agent” law on Tuesday, ignoring massive protests against what the US and the European Union have condemned as a “Kremlin-inspired” measure.
title: Georgian Parliament Overrides Veto of ‘Foreign Agent’ Law

description: Canada won’t allow itself to become a foothold for oversupplied Chinese goods that could pass through to its democratic allies, Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland said.
title: China Can’t Use Canada as Trade Path for Cheap Goods, Freeland Says

description: The European Union is nearing a deal on measures that would make it easier to wind down smaller lenders that run into trouble, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Nears Deal on Failed Lenders in Path to Closer Banking Ties

description: A Polish parliamentary committee moved closer to potentially summoning the country’s central bank governor by officially notifying Adam Glapinski of its probe following a lengthy delay.
title: Poland Moves Closer to Summoning Central Banker as Probe Starts

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Back In Business: Labour and the Conservatives Compete For Economic Appeal

description: Saudi Arabia’s King Salman bin Abdulaziz chaired a weekly cabinet session by tuning in remotely, the official Saudi Press Agency reported, in a sign the 88-year-old monarch may be better after getting treated for an illness.
title: Saudi Crown Prince Says King Salman Has Recovered After Illness

description: On In the City, we hear how financial executives are fine with turning the page on the Tories, but want to hear the policy details first.
title: City of London Sees Labour’s Return as Chance for Stability

description: Donald Trump and Todd Blanche speak to members of the media at Manhattan criminal court in New York on May 20. Photographer: Sarah Yenesel/EPA/Bloomberg
title: Closing Arguments in Trump Hush-Money Trial

description: Nigel Farage entered the UK election campaign in his trademark fashion on Tuesday, saying Rishi Sunak called an early vote to distract from the failure of his anti-immigration policy and that any support for the prime minister’s ruling Conservative Party on July 4 would be a “wasted vote.”
title: Farage Attacks Sunak on Immigration in First UK Campaign Speech

description: Dick Schoof, a top official in the Dutch Ministry of Justice and Security, has been selected as the next prime minister by the four parties seeking to form a coalition in the Netherlands.
title: Dutch Election Winner Wilders Taps Ex-Spy Chief as Premier

description: Israeli tanks have reached the center of Rafah in southern Gaza, AFP reported, citing witnesses.
title: Israeli Tanks Have Reached the Center of Rafah, AFP Reports

description: Four-week average flows were down for a third straight week
title: Russia’s Seaborne Crude Exports Drop Ahead of OPEC+ Meeting

description: Investor demand surged at South Africa’s weekly government bond sale on Tuesday, a day ahead of a general election that could be pivotal for markets.
title: Demand Surges at South Africa Bond Auction Before Key Election

description: Rachel Reeves said a Labour government would prioritize economic stability, workers’ rights and business interests, as she sought to forge a dividing line with the Conservative Party’s “reckless” tax cuts and accused Rishi Sunak of repeating the mistakes of Liz Truss.
title: Labour Seeks Dividing Line With Tories Over ‘Reckless’ Tax Cuts

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping pledged to prioritize youth employment and direct more resources to job creation at a Politburo study session on Monday, according to the official Xinhua News Agency.
title: China’s Xi Pledges to Make Youth Employment a Top Priority

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Bengal Chief Minister’s Stronghold May Remain Unimpressed by Modi in India’s Elections

description: Hundreds of cannabis entrepreneurs, farmers and activists rallied in Bangkok and threatened legal action against the Thai government as it pushes ahead with a plan to reclassify marijuana as a narcotic just two years after decriminalizing it.
title: Thai Cannabis Supporters Plan Legal Challenge of Policy U-Turn

description: Rwanda deployed an additional 2,000 soldiers to natural-gas rich Mozambique, where Islamic State-linked violence that’s delayed a $20 billion TotalEnergies SE project for three years, has surged in recent months.
title: Rwanda Deploys 2,000 More Troops to Gas-Rich Mozambique Region

description: Novo Nordisk A/S has a greater impact on Denmark’s employment levels than previously estimated, according to the state’s fiscal watchdog, aggravating concerns the Nordic economy is becoming too dependent on the pharmaceutical giant.
title: Novo’s Impact on Danish Jobs Greater Than Thought, Watchdog Says

description: Former Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy is calling for “large-scale” job cuts, three board seats and more conservative voices at BuzzFeed Inc. according to a letter to the company’s board that was reviewed by Bloomberg News.
title: Ramaswamy Urges BuzzFeed to Cut Jobs, Air More Conservative Voices

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Iran in Mourning Is Still a Nuclear Headache

description: Hong Kong’s national security police arrested six people using a new security law for the first time, days ahead of the 35th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square crackdown.
title: Hong Kong Makes First Arrests Under New Local Security Law

description: European Union defense ministers on Tuesday are debating whether to allow Ukraine to strike targets deeper inside Russian territory with weapons that have been sent by member states.
title: EU Nations Discuss Easing Restrictions on Weapons Sent to Kyiv

description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana said he is prepared to stay in his current role after the election and urged the country to choose stability over “chaos” by voting for the African National Congress.
title: Godongwana Says to Stay as S. Africa Finance Minister If Asked

description: Spain, Norway and Ireland are set to recognize a Palestinian state on Tuesday, deepening diplomatic tensions with Israel as the war in Gaza rages.
title: Spain, Norway, Ireland to Formally Recognize Palestinian State

description: Australia and the European Union have struck an agreement to boost cooperation and investment in critical minerals, part of a drive by Western nations to loosen China’s grip on supply chains of materials essential to high-tech and green manufacturing.
title: EU, Australia Sign Critical Minerals Pact to Diversify Supply Chains

description: South African labor union Solidarity challenged the government’s new health-insurance law in court and urged other groups to join its legal battle.
title: South African Labor Union Challenges New Health Law in Court

description: Pro-Russian disinformation groups are exploiting the “very, very lax” rules on Telegram and there’s little EU authorities can do about it.
title: Too Small to Police, Too Big to Ignore: Telegram Is the App Dividing Europe

description: Gilts and the pound are relaxed about the prospect of Keir Starmer becoming prime minister.
title: UK Markets Aren’t Afraid of a Labour Government

description: Newsroom staff at Slovakia’s most-watched private broadcaster accused the outlet of caving to political pressure as tension over media independence in the country intensified in the aftermath of the assassination attempt on Prime Minister Robert Fico.
title: Slovak Broadcaster Faces Revolt Over ‘Orbanization’ of Media

description: A top Colombian court rejected the government’s request to postpone paying back unconstitutional royalty taxes to oil and mining companies, further straining the country’s fiscal finances.
title: Colombia Court Rejects Petro’s Plan to Delay Royalty Tax Refund

description: Protesters are gathering in Taipei as opposition lawmakers try to push through controversial legislation giving them greater investigative powers and effectively curbing the authority of President Lai Ching-te.
title: Taiwan Protesters Gather as Opposition Pushes Contentious Law

description: President Javier Milei replaced his cabinet chief as the government’s major economic reform plans languish in Argentina’s congress, hoping a seasoned negotiator can get them over the finish line.
title: Milei Swaps Out His Cabinet Chief in Bid for Sign-Off on Reforms

description: In one week, the world will know whether Narendra Modi pulled off his historic bid for a third term as India’s leader. But win or lose, a wide range of possible election outcomes awaits India’s next prime minister — each with different implications for the new government.
title: Four India Election Scenarios and What They Would Mean for Modi
